comment._content: Hans-Joachim Marseille. His rank in the German Air Force was Hauptmann = captain.

comment.author: 49487266@N07
comment.authorname: San Diego Air & Space Museum Archives

comment.author: 54904823@N00
comment._content: Hans-Joachim Marseille (13 December 1919 – 30 September 1942; German pronunciation: [hants joˈaχɪm mɑrˈseɪ]) was a Luftwaffe fighter pilot and flying ace during World War II. He is noted for his aerial battles during the North African Campaign and his Bohemian lifestyle. One of the best fighter pilots of World War II, he was nicknamed the "Star of Africa". Marseille claimed all but seven of his "official" 158 victories against the British Commonwealth's Desert Air Force over North Africa, flying the Messerschmitt Bf 109 fighter for his entire combat career. No other pilot claimed as many Western Allied aircraft as Marseille en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Hans-Joachim_Marseille
